sen.e: Enyu-ji Temple was a gogan-ji (temple built by imperial order) of Emperor Enyu that once stood in Kyoto.

sen.j: 円融寺は、円融天皇の勅願寺として983年（永観元）に創建された。
sen.e: Enyu-ji Temple was founded as a chokugan-ji (temple constructed by imperial order) of Emperor Enyu in the year 983.

sen.j: 円融天皇没後の円融寺は、次第に衰退していき、平安時代末になると藤原実能が同寺址に山荘を建てた。
sen.e: Following Emperor Enyu's death, Enyu-ji Temple gradually fell into decline and FUJIWARA no Saneyoshi built a villa on the site of the temple at the end of the Heian period.
